swell.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to become larger and rounder than normal – used especially about parts of the body
swell.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Her ankle was already starting to swell.
The window frame had swollen shut.
swell.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to increase in amount or number
swell.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The river was swollen with melted snow.
Large numbers of refugees have swollen the ranks of the unemployed.
swell.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to curve or make something curve
swell.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to move suddenly and powerfully upwards
swell.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the way the sea moves up and down
swell.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The sea wasn’t rough, but there was a heavy swell (=large movements of the water).
swell.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a situation in which something increases in number or amount
swell.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: the growing swell of anti-government feeling
swell.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: an increase in sound level, especially in music
swell.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: the roundness or curved shape of something
swell.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: the firm swell of her breasts
